problem.h2: A Collision and up the loop- conceptual
problem.p: A block of mass m1, suspended by a string as shown in the figure, is released from rest at an unknown height H. At the bottom of its trajectory it hits a block of mass m2 initially at rest. Block m1 stops and block m2 moves until it encounters a vertical circular track of radius R. There is no friction along blockâ€™s 2 trajectory. The goal is to determine H is block 2 looses contact with the track at the angle \(\theta\) shown in the figure.
Which of the following strategies could you use to solve this problem?

choicegroup.choice: Use conservation of mechanical energy of the block 1-earth system to find the velocity of block 1 immediately before the collision; then use conservation of kinetic energy to find the velocity of block 2 immediately after the collision; then analyze the forces on the block at the given angle \(\theta\), and use this to find solve for H.

Use conservation of mechanical energy of the block 1- earth system to find the velocity of block 1 immediately before the collision; then use conservation of momentum to find the velocity of block 2 immediately after the collision; then use conservation of mechanical energy of the block 2-earth system to find the given angle \(\theta\), and use this to solve for H.
